text: I never thought that I was a great
father until this happened and I realize
now that I was doing all the right
things you know I was doing the best
that I could
on the way down to the World Trade
Center in the police-court they saw the
second plane go into the building and I
know that he called his wife I've never
learned what was said over the phone I
have never accepted what happened to
Bruce I did a lot of crazy things
searching for Brooks I would look at
homeless people in the street and I
would look at them very closely when I
was walking along I went for counseling
for maybe a year and I felt that that
wasn't really helping me I had decided
to never come back here again but I did
come back and that helped a lot because
I looked around especially when spring
comes and I see Bruce much of the garden
here adhesive reason that it's here
because he came here every day during
the summer and he did a lot of
preservation work he would put in the
ivy whether it had roots or not and he
would water at every single day during
the summer time until finally it rooted
and became adapted to the area here and
began to spread so that's why this
particular area is very important to me
as far as murmuring Bruce
this bench the memorial bench is in
honor of my wife in memory of my wife
you find it very difficult to live alone
when you've lived with somebody for that
many years my cooking is horrible I've
had several friends by for dinner and I
could tell when they were eating the
dinner
something is wrong the expression on
their face and I decided not to do that
anymore but this is my wife I loved her
so much and she was really an incredibly
beautiful woman I mean when she walked
down the street people stopped I mean
everybody stopped and looked at her but
with Bruce it's amazing that he was a
police officer but yet he lived this
life with a great love for nature and
for things that are wild you know
a really great life
